Name: Surya Katakam
Title: Jantar Mantar Delhi is one of the Five built in India
Review: Jantar Mantar of Delhi was built by Maharaja Jay Singh II of Jaipur way back in 1724. Maharaja Jay Singh-II had a lot of interest in astronomy and astrology,  He was good Mathematician, town planner and a very good ruler as well. He had mastered four languages: Arabic, Greek, Persian and Sanskrit. There are total 5 Jantar Mantar's in North India at Mathura, Ujjain, Varanasi, Delhi and Jaipur which were completed between 1724 to 1737. The Delhi Jantar Mantar is the one which was constructed First compare to other four of India. Second one is Varanasi, Third Mathura, Fourth Ujjain and the fifth one is Jaipur. Jaipur one was constructed at the last and in a vast area. All instruments in Jaipur Jantar Mantar are still in working condition and remaining four including Delhi are incomplete constructions and not in working condition. All these four were built for trail and but finalized in Jaipur.The main purpose of building the observatory was to collect astronomical tables and to make accurate estimates of the motions of the planets, the Moon and the Sun. Jantar Mantar is a huge complex to learn about space and time. Jantar Mantar is actually Sanskrit work, Jantar means Machine/Instrument  and Mantra means formula/Calculation. overall meaning of Jantar Mantar is "Machine that calculate". Delhi Jantar Mantar consists of 13 architectural instruments. But among these the most noticeable ones areMishra Yantra which is resembling the formation of a Spade, this heart shaped structure is symbolic of Delhi. It was used to figure out noon in different cities across the world.Samrat Yantra is the famous giant triangular sundial that raises to a height of 70 feet. It is an instrument that measures time accurately.Jayaprakash Yantra is one of the most captivating instrument. This is actually a hollow hemisphere which reflects every point in the Sky.Ram Yantra which measures altitude of Stars, this structure consists of two cylindrical buildings containing radial lines that spread out from a center.Patel Chowk and Rajeev Chowk are nearest Railway stations to reach Delhi Jantar Mantar.Timings:Morning 06:00 to Evening 06:00Entry Fee:25 INR for Indian's and 300 INR for Foreigners.

Name: shubhamoys
Title: Jantar mantar
Review: Great place. A lot of scientific information. Must visit with children. The place is very relaxing with lots of trees around.

Name: Lakshmi Biradar
Title: Great instruments of astronomy
Review: Jantar Mantar is located in Connaught place. “Jantar Mantar” literally means “instruments for measuring the harmony of the heavens”. It consists of 13 architectural astronomy instruments. The Ram Yantra, the Samrat Yantra, the Jai Prakash Yantra and the Misra Yantra are the distinct instruments of Jantar Mantar. Entry free is 15 to 20 Rs.

Name: SiddharthBhandari
Title: Good place
Review: Upkeep is always I progress.Off course the building is old and that is the beauty.The placards give you good Information to understand the concept of the observatories.Ample parkingEasy to accessJanpath market located close by.

Name: Vaidehi15
Title: Magical construction to site
Review: Its magical construction to see. Kids will love watching & experiencing moving around on step. The place is not very well maintained thus not too attractive to see.

Name: A Choudhury
Title: Historical Place
Review: There are 13 astronomy instruments used in those days to observe the movements of the sun, moon and planets. One can visit with family or friends and spend a couple of hours here.

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Astronomical treat
Review: Jantar Mantar is a old time observatory for those interested in Astronomy.It has various Yantra's (instruments) for measuring various parameters of our solar system like time of the day, altitude of sun, moon, stars,  etc.  For those not so deep into astronomy, still its a fantastic place to spend some time and wonder how beautiful pieces of architectures were conceptualised, made and used during old times.The place can be reached through Violet or Yellow Metro lines. The ticket charges are nominal and online ticket can also be taken through paytm (just scan barcode, fill name, ID, phone no. and pay). There is a locker facility for carry-on bags.The lush green garden inside is well maintained and beautiful.Overall a must visit place for all ages.

Name: Bitturaj
Title: Old is gold
Review: Really old is gold when I visited it here the constitution work was happening may be. Now construction is completed and now, it looks beautiful.

Name: Sherry G
Title: a nice place for a stroll before most sights are open
Review: I was up early and no where to go, so decided to stroll through the astronomical devices. The guard was helpful. I knew nothing when I arrived and learned a few things too. Enjoy!

Name: macedonboy
Title: Astronomy
Review: Saw this back in December and forgot to write a review until now. These are 18th century astronomical instruments primarily for compiling the times and movements of the sun, moon and planets, and for predicting their future movements. These ones in Delhi were also built by the Rajput ruler Jai Singh II and are very similar to the Jantar Mantar in Jaipur, also built by the same dude. The difference between these and the ones in Jaipur are that these are terracotta coloured. The Jantar Mantar here is bigger but less well maintained than the ones in Jaipur. If I hadn’t already seen the ones in Jaipur, I would’ve given this a higher score. The entrance price is also quite steep if you’re a foreigner just to see astronomical instruments that no longer function.

Name: Debashis T
Title: Not maintained
Review: With an entry fee of Rs.25/- for adult, this is now popular for Dharna place rather than a monument.People also come here and use this as a park. But no doubt, it also has many fine structures to see.But almost all the instruments build in cemented platform are detoriating,   lost its color and shine. But whatever remains are good and useful.

Name: Gl0balCitizen2013
Title: Indian astronomical building/s a few 100 years old
Review: Jantar Mantar is another iconic New Delhi building that every Indian has seen a picture of in their school textbooks. It was constructed a few 100 years ago by the Maharaja of Jaipur to make accurate astronomical calculations. The main building is a sundial and it is quite accurate. The different buildings comprise of different "yantras" to calculate time, seasons, astronomical events etc. There is a lot of maths /measurementsinvolved and visiting with a knowledgeable guide would make your visit much more rewarding.Even without a guide, we enjoyed our visit.

Name: sanjayvora45
Title: Sundial
Review: Jantar Mantar was built by Maharaja Jai singh of Jaipur in 1723. Purpose of observatory is to predict the times and  movements of the sun.4 instruments inside the observatory are - samrat yantra, jayaprakash, Rama yantra, misra yantra.During 1727 to 1734 Maharaja Jai Singh of jaipur had built total 5 such observatory named jantar mantar across north india, others are at - jaipur, ujjain, mathura, varanasi.

Name: Afzal920
Title: Delhi tour
Review: Very nice place nearest place to our hotel..,.... Impressive architecture....... After check out from hotel we visit this place...

Name: Navin Kumar Askaran
Title: History and magnificence of simplicity
Review: Jantar mantar is an epicenter of history in Delhi and one of those attractions that’s simple yet has had a profound influence over long periods of time.

Name: Dipanwita K
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: This is the historical monument built by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh II of Jaipur. If you really want to understand the functionality of this architectural astronomy instruments, visit with guide & on a sunny day. Otherwise, it is just a monument with lots of pillars. My request to all the visitors, please don't  signature on the wall as this has already copyright by Maharaja Sawai Jai Singh.

Name: Sandeep Dhatt
Title: Nice place
Review: Jantar mantar is very nice place in delhi.its located near india gate but every time there are some peace ful protests are going on this place.other it's example of nice art and craft.

Name: sharjeelcool
Title: Good
Review: This place is Indeed the land mark and I must definitely recommend to each and every person who is visiting the capital

Name: Sunil
Title: Ancient Jantar mantra
Review: The place is good .It has it's own history and early geographical measurements was done by this construction

Name: ghoomboom
Title: Disappointed...
Review: We visited this place on a saturday morning. One can buy tickets from early morning (I think from 6:30 AM). The visit to this place was very disappointing. Nothing much to see. Maintenance is in a bad shape and many areas are out of bounds. Even the structures (Instruments) in Jantar Mantar do not carry detailed information boards for the benefit of visitors. I think it is being renovated so anybody planning to visit this place first see if it has been fully renovated. At present, a visit will only lead to disappointed.

Name: CleopatraLuxor
Title: Scientific instruments of the past
Review: Astronomical instruments of the past. Helped to set time and make observations of the sky. Very scientific description of yantras and how they were used in relation to sundials. Complex but beautiful structures.

Name: ashishdeora123
Title: nice
Review: Among the five major Jantar Mantar constructed by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur, the one in which Delhi Indian citizens should pay INR 5 and foreign nationals have to pay INR 100.

Name: jazsacher
Title: worth a stop
Review: We enjoyed our brief visit to Jantar Mantar in Delhi.  This place in my opinion was much more enjoyable that the equivalent in Jaipur and there were very few tourists here when we visited.  I liked the style and the vibe here much more than Jantar Mantar although I felt this place was very small compared to the Jaipur equivalent.  Overall, it was an interesting visit and we got some nice shots.  I would recommend Jantar Mantar for a quick visit.

Name: Soma S
Title: Could have been an Amazing Place
Review: I visited this place with my family in a half day New delhi tour. I heard about this place since my childhood and had a great expectation but when reached, I found this place is avarage or below that. This is a collection of 5 astronomical instrument structrure made by Raja Joy Singh in 18th century. It required more researcha nd studies to improve this place. A demonstration of each instrument would a be a great help for visitors to understand this complex astronomical theory.

Name: dshan2016
Title: Jantar Mantar - Waste of time
Review: I went with my kid. But everything is looking so dull that we fill it is just waste of time. it takes hardly 10 to 20mins to visit. there is entry fee and clock room facility is also available.

Name: Rkjrocks
Title: Casual
Review: It's a nice place to visit and roam around. This place is mainly popular for protest these days against the government. Much more to explore..

Name: rama1
Title: Could have been so much better
Review: A bit disappointed as I had read about it before my visit.The engineering and physics is beyond reproach, but the grounds are neglected and the signage is basic.  Signs don't really explain what the constructions do which is disappointing.

Name: 792Carol_H
Title: run down waste of time
Review: This is another area which is a disgrace, it has so much potential as a great tourist attraction but has been forgotten as so many things in India are.Jantar Mantar dates back to 1724 and translates literally as" instruments formulae". The 13 structures are large architectural astronomy instruments used to make accurate observations for the purpose of predicting solar, lunar and planetary movements.They really did not have any clear explanations on how the structures worked which is a shame as hubby likes this sort of stuff.Everything was so run down it was a waste of time pun intended.

Name: Sushant Khera
Title: Amazed!!!
Review: You will be amazed to see the monumental astronomical instruments (some being the largest in their category) and the simplicity through which they have been designed to provide astronomical insights even with naked eyes. It is a beautifully maintained small complex with yellow painted walls. Despite compound bustling with tourists and children (being a long weekend), we could easily navigate around and see instruments. To understand the working of all the instruments.

Name: Peter I
Title: Amazing Constructions
Review: I rather liked this place with its weird constructions, used to track time and the movements of planets.  Its situated right beside Jaipur's City Palace. The building program was initiated by Jai Singh II in 1728, with restoration carried out in 1901. There are a number of massive sundials each one bigger than the next which were built to give greater accuracy in telling the time. Its reputed that the largest one could tell the time with accuracy to 2 seconds. Impressive for the 18th century. Also check out the series of astrological constructions, one each for the signs of the zodiac. Without a guide to explain what's going on just enjoy loooking at the exhibits on a short visit and cross over to the City Palace.

Name: Shobha
Title: One of the most visited tourist place in Delhi
Review: Entry fees is also not expensive . My kids wanted to come here so we added it to our tour list and it was actually worth visiting here . We also went to Bhairavi temple there .

Name: MATIAS
Title: NICE OBESERVATORY
Review: Sawa jai singh .ll of jaipur a keen astronomer .built this obeservatory.in 1724 he because he wanted to caiculate planetary positions and alignment accurately we like this place .jantar mantar near cp just 500 meter.

Name: Jovial Holiday
Title: Best place to visit in Delhi with your family
Review: Located in the Parliament Street, Jantar Mantar Delhi was built by Maharaja Jai Singh in 1724. You can see here Samrat Yantra, Jaya Prakash Yantra, Rama Yantra, and Misra Yantra. This is the best place to visit in Delhi with your family.

Name: Anup251
Title: A giant sundial
Review: Visited this place in the morning. Could not find a guide. Wish we could understand the mechanism. Unless someone explains, it is just an architectural beauty.

Name: Arjun Verma
Title: Good Place to Visit
Review: This is actually a nice place. You must visit this place to understand how Indian had mastered the subject of Astronomy in the ancient times and the knowledge was exhibited for practical learning of common citizens. Jantar Mantar is an observatory of ancient times. You have to pay the entry charges around 25/- rupees per person. full of greenery.nice place to visit with kids. avoid during summers. not a must go if you are visiting for a short trip.

Name: Dinker P
Title: An important place to visit for mathematicians, civil engineers and astrologers.
Review: Jantar Mantar is one of the important places that one should not miss while visiting Delhi. This is constructed in an era where time was measured by the sunlight falling on its different structures. The longest and shortest day of the year, the change of seasons, midday, etc were interpreted with the help of the instruments/structures built over here.Aspiring students should visit to draw inspiration to explore and create new such monuments in the country.During our visit Mr. Sharma, who was a retired care taker explained us the aspects of each structure and how time was computed while sunlight falls on it.THIS IS A PLACE THAT EVERYONE SHOULD VISIT WHEN IN DELHI.

Name: Souvik Saha
Title: A sun dial amidst the city center
Review: This place is located very close to Connaught place. The historical sundial is still a major attraction in New Delhi.

Name: Irving Washington
Title: Nice place to relax in the centre of the city
Review: This is actually a nice place. It is in the very centre, among high buildings and crowded streets, so this place gives you an opportunity to escape this whole rush outside. There are nice old astronomical tools - buildings, which where used to measure time, solstice, etc.

Name: A R Kohli
Title: Astronomy is explained practically here
Review: You must visit this place to understand how Indian had mastered the subject of Astronomy in the ancient times and the knowledge was exhibited for practical learning of a common citizens. You must visit with a good guide to make your visit meaningful and enjoyable.Amolak Rattan Kohli Former Governor of Mizoram

Name: Ishuarav
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: Jantar Mantar is an observatory of ancient times. The place is worth to watch if you are really interested in astronomical facts otherwise nothing exciting! Ample car parking is available. 30 minutes is sufficient to walk around and witness the construction!

Name: Bala Tripura S
Title: Must visit place
Review: We need to pay entrance fee of 25 rs to enter this monument complex.We can catch bus #181 from NDLS railway station.Even though this is smaller as compared to jaipur jantar mantar ,but it is must visit if you are a science student.There are almost 6 scientific instruments inside this complex and there is not a guide who can explain about each instrument

Name: pickytweeter
Title: Lal Astronomy
Review: Amazing structures but needs more TLC and explanations- as has been said.  We were harassed on entry, harassed on exit and harassed going round. Staff were sulky. Couples and colgate squirels everywhere. Take Sansad Marg  going out from Connaught place to get to entrance -coz if u come round from Janpath you end up with uncrossable roadds, roads dug up more harassement etc  + just seeing the monument thru the park railings!! which is doable I suppose if you want to save yr self entrance fee + harassment!! There are some explanations and facts on plaques within.

Name: RAJENDRA884 PRASAD
Title: Solar Powered Heritage Monument
Review: Jantar Mantar is a Sun-Dial, which is a historical monument and I was happy to see that this has recently been powered with the every of Sun, that is, Solar Power.

Name: PatrickInUk
Title: Brief visit – missing a trick on explanations
Review: This was underwhelming. Our Tuk Tuk driver seemed to have trouble finding it and dropped us off some distance away – leaving us a bit of a circular walk to finally get to the entrance. Once in, yes the relic building were pretty, but many of the steps and walkways were closed and blocked off. We read the many information boards but we really felt some clearer better visual explanations would have been useful to show how these structures actually worked. I promised myself to search for that once I get home.

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: nice and good
Review: Well maintained .Built with sandstone and marble.Its fascinating to see the well constructed architecture wonder which depicts the time.Visit this place for the love for science.Entry is not that costly as well

Name: Olivia R
Title: Not worth the money
Review: We are a young couple (late 20s) travelling India and with so many free sites I wouldn’t recommend spending the 300 rupees per person for this site unless you are really into ancient observatories/astronomy. We thought it would be cool but it was quite underwhelming and very small.

Name: Wungyaopem
Title: Global Naga Rally
Review: It's a very good place for rally. The surrounding areas are well maintained and proper security are available. We had a very successful and awesome rally. Keep it up. Thank you.

Name: Middlemiss
Title: Amazing Observatory
Review: Built again in sandstone and marble by Jai Singh in 1724. How on earth you would measure stars in the 16th century, I am amazed at the detail and accuracy achieved when you are crudely carving stone.

Name: namrata s
Title: old monument
Review: nice place to visit with kids. avoid during summers. not a must go if you are visiting for a short trip.

Name: WTWT_57
Title: See the Jantar Mantar in Jaipur instead
Review: If you aren’t going to be in Jaipur, then go ahead and see this observatory, but the one in Jaipur is bigger and in much better condition. (And less expensive)

Name: Aritri
Title: Jantar Mantar -  An outdoor museum of thirteen architectural and astrological instruments
Review: Jantar Mantar is one of the famous tourist destinations of New Delhi. In 18th century Rajput king Saiwai Jai Singh II built five astronomical observatory (Jantar Mantar) in India. Jantar Mantar of New Delhi is one of these five. This observatory consists of thirteen architectural and astrological instruments for measuring exact time and other astronomical calculations.

Name: StratosLFC
Title: Not worth visiting
Review: Nothing special in this placeExpensive (for India) to enterIf you want to save time and money, just skip this place.

Name: SangeetaSharmaJaifal
Title: Time of old times
Review: Jantar mantra the time peace or we can say old method of Indian kings to check time . There are three time check systems buildings and all are differently amezing and interesting. Must see

Name: durham05
Title: Well wroth checking out
Review: Not as impressive as it's more famous counterpart in Jaipur, but still worth checking out. Some impressive astronomical structures. Gardens are also very pleasant.

Name: Chintan m
Title: Worth visiting...
Review: Jantar Mantar was built by Raja jai SINGH of jaipur. It was built to identify the movements of Sun moon and earth. Worth visiting this place for sure

Name: Karthik139
Title: Excellent observatory
Review: This place is located in Connaught place has instruments that were built in 1700s to tell time, date etc. You can spend an interesting hour here, but you a need a guide to explain stuff, else they appear as random shaped building in an open ground. The place is clean but has the instruments/observatories have not been maintained well. There are no pamphlets/brochures either. Couldn’t find authorised guides as well. The security guards double up as guides and do a fairly good job of explaining. Charges are around RS 200-300

Name: Abhishek
Title: Average
Review: Visited the place as heard a lot but it was disappointing. Not maintained at all....although it’s a historical marvel, needs immediate action by responsible authorities. Clicked photos which came out well.

Name: 2torontotraveller
Title: Old Architectural Astronomy Instruments
Review: This site is in keeping with India's interest in the sciences.  This site has 13 architectural astronomy instruments which were built in 1724 (long before modern equipment existed).  They were used to compile astronomical tables to help predict the times and movements of the sun, moon and planets.  This site is interesting to walk around.  There are lots of tourists and romantic couples.  It is expensive for foreigners to enter as the entrance fee is 300 INR.

Name: Plan H
Title: Nice calendar and astronomical tables
Review: the structures in the Jantar Mantar observatory in New Delhi that was placed there in 1910 mistakenly dating the construction of the complex to the year 1710.

Name: Subrata Chakraborty
Title: Jantar Mantar lost its importance
Review: The Archeological Department is taking too much money for entry. Lost its importance due to negligence.I t is almost turned into park for couples.Need some good attention. The Dept don't allow to go inside the structure.

Name: Sanjiv
Title: Wow!
Review: An observatory built centuries ago showing how advanced the science of time, seasons and space were known. It does not look much but you will be blown away by how this monument works and is accurate to the second!

Name: Gyanendra
Title: Fabulous place
Review: Janata manter was one of part of our tour in may and we had enjoyed full day. Among the five major Jantar Mantar constructed by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur, the one in which Delhi has an equal reputation as of the Jaipur one. At Delhi Jantar Mantar, there are 13 architectural astronomy instruments.

Name: Priya M
Title: Historical Astronomical place
Review: Its historical astronomical place situated in heart of delhi. Its popular with people who like to protest.

Name: Amolak Rattan K
Title: Astronomy defined with physical structure
Review: A good learning experience for any visitor abou ancient ways of predicting time and events . One has to spend time with a good guide to really get to understand every structure and its importance .   Governor Amolak Rattan Kohli

Name: MoushumiBhattacharya
Title: Ancient Observatory!
Review: Built by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur, it was primarily built to compile astronomical tables. Situated in the heart of the city, this place remains a popular tourist destination although these days it is synonym with protests and candle lights marches. It consists of 13 architectural astronomy instruments which can be used to compile the astronomical tables and to predict the movement and timings of the sun, moon and planets.

Name: VINAY S
Title: Amazing place for feel the history..
Review: Its one of the famous places in delhi to visit.. it has both political as well as historical importance.. Must visit once to witness both..

Name: Ashwin Vemuri
Title: Jantar Mantar
Review: Lost in between the Iconic Buildings and/or Offices on Sansad Marg aka Parliament Street. Old World Charm and Delhi History Inscribed...Built by a Jaipur Maharaja in 1723... Speaks about Indian Astronomical Calculations...

Name: keith h
Title: Tranquil area near Connaught Place.
Review: The entrance fee of 100rs is quite low for a Delhi attraction but there are plenty of the astronomical structures, they have not been restored as well as the one in Jaipur, a UNESCO site (500rs), but it is interesting to vist. We visited in monsoon season, so had an overcast sky, but was still worth a visit.

Name: Chandan P
Title: A dharna place
Review: Jantar mantar on the parliament street near connaught place is now a days become the dharna place for the peoples demands from the government to agitate there.Earlier this place was made to see the timings of suns shadows, time was calculated accordingly.

Name: Rajesh Karkera
Title: Ancient Indian science and astronomy revisited.
Review: Jantar Mantar was built by Maharaja Jai Singh II of Jaipur in 1723. Basically, the complex has 13 astronomical yantras(calculators) which calculate the positions of various planets and sun etc. They also help to build astronomical tables. Similar constructions have been done by Jai Singh at Jaipur, Ujjain, Mathura and Varanasi. The place is maintained well now. It's a great experience to visit the place and be part of Indian heritage.

Name: SusieMcGr
Title: So very interesting!
Review: Wonderful historic experience, though quite rundown!  A guide is a good idea to help appreciate the intricate details and works of all the monuments.

Name: Jeevika S
Title: Its all about time!
Review: A place where one can get to know about the time through sunlight.Therr is a big dial inside, where when the sun lights falls , highlights the dial / strings. Through which one can het ti know the time.It was used in ancient time.You should go and watch how it works.

Name: israr mansuri
Title: Beautiful
Review: A lovely huge place in cannaught palace road near sansad Marg posh area of Delhi.A historical and astronomical place in early years clock that time people use this instument

Name: Seshadri S
Title: Timeless Marvels
Review: A very quiet place to be.  There are various monuments here which are supposed to depict the time correctly.  Most of them are not working.  But you can admire the knowledge that was prevalent in the old days to correctly estimate the time, just by looking at the sun's shadow.  Some of the displays are barricaded now.  During childhood I remember it was fully open and you could go inside some of the displays and also climb to the top of some displays with the help of staircases.

Name: Milan Patel
Title: Astronomical wonder of India
Review: In ancient India many monuments and wonders had been made by Kings. Jantar Mantar located in Delhi is one of them. It's a mind blowing astronomical wonder of ancient India.

Name: Royson S
Title: Great
Review: Fascinating for their ingenuity, the instruments at Jantar Mantar can no longer be used accurately because of the tall buildings around.

Name: Alok B
Title: Interesting structure but difficult to understand
Review: I was always thinking to visit Jantar Mantar and when I decided to visit there it was hot summer of May and it was very difficult to stay there longer.I found structures very interesting as it was used  in astronomy but I found it difficult to understand.

Name: karan a
Title: Good example of indian architecture!!
Review: Good example of Indian architecture!!It was built hundreds years ago by our great mathematicians!! You will find great Indian concept here!!

Name: dobbieni
Title: Hidden Gem
Review: A quiet peice of Delhi. Just not the one structure but a group of mathamatical structures relating to the galaxy. one marvels at the construction and accuracy of the ancients

Name: Purvi P
Title: Too hot to visit in May !
Review: U need to Guide to understand the nuisances of this place , otherwise it’s just place structures build for you. The way it’s made is absolutely mind blowing to know the time of the day here in India. Also the section which can get u information related to solar system and Nakshatras is marvellous. It’s not so well maintained . The Jaipur one is better with Marbles finish. The garden is clean however hope they keep it in better condition.

Name: Karthik Das
Title: Jantar Mantar - Architecture of astronimical proportions
Review: Generally people associate Delhi's  Jantar Mantar as one for peaceful marches and a protest site. Like its famed counterpart in Jaipur, this contains some architectural wonders of medieval times which required a thorough understanding of astronomy, solar and lunar calendars,geography and architecture ofcourse. Be sure to hire a guide who will tell you the significance of the choice of selection of the place, the many curiously shaped edifices which have some connection with either the Sun, moon, Pole Star or the Solstice and Equinox. An engineering and architectural marvel.

Name: ranjanapathak
Title: Informative Heritage building
Review: Jantar Mantar,  a world heritage sight, is an astronomical observatory. There are manyinstruments inside the Jantar Mantar, to name the few like Samrat Yantra, Jai Prakash, Ram Yantra, Niyati Chakra, and Misra Yantra.   All these instruments can be used for various astronomical calculations. Jantar Mantar  is open to public from 10 am to 6 pm. There is nominal entry fee. One can reach here by Metro (Patel Chowk Metro Station).

Name: bindu2016
Title: Historical spot
Review: This is a historical spot situated in connaught place.. you must visit this is winters as it get very hot in summers. it is basically for time and movement of Sun and planets.

Name: Aadhes
Title: Historical place
Review: This is a historical place with scientific explanations. Main theme is astronautical, this place shows how advance Indians in past. This place and the Gardens are well maintained there is entry fee for this place. If you have some time then you can go here.

Name: RajeevAbuDhabi
Title: Historical Monument
Review: Jantar mantar sounds like some magical words . This historical monument is located near Connaught place close to Janpath market .There is a Ticket entry to this place .Its was really amazing see this historical monument and read about it and take pictures .

Name: Shalini S
Title: Good
Review: One of the tourist attraction of delhi and is good for family and friends hangout. Place is clean and have good view and park inside it. Good for photography and one can get a good view from here of cp.

Name: KANewYork
Title: Interesting astronomical structures
Review: There is an entry fee and tickets are sold right outside the gates. Indians get cheaper tickets. The gardens are kept fairly neat. The building could use a bit more TLC.

Name: Myrddin
Title: needs much more information
Review: I was really looking forward to going here and had I been able to know more about it I am sure I would have enjoyed it a lot more.  it needs a lot more information on how the actual place works.It's a very popular place, but I am sure the majority have no idea how things work.shame really

Name: Ravindra V
Title: Astronomical brilliance
Review: This building is architectural brilliance. You shouldn't miss this if you have interest in astronomy. People of all ages would like it. Make sure you are lost in the puzzle.

Name: Rezwanur R
Title: Won't feel amused if you aren't into astrology
Review: I wasn't eager to visit this place but my friend insisted so I had to accompany him. There are some structures made to point out the direction of stars & other Astro related things. You'll get some good framing for pictures.but yeah, it gets boring after spending more than half an hour.At least I didn't enjoy this place much.

Name: sumitkumar20993
Title: An Astronomical Place
Review: At Jantar Mantar, I came with my some friends with a curiosity. I had heard a lot about Jantar Mantar from my childhood. When I was in Delhi first time, I planned for the Jantar Mantar with some of my friends. When we reached there we took tickets. There were two categories of tickets, one for the Indian and other for the foreigners. We entered in the campus of Jantar Mantar, the place was decorated with the green grass, flowers, plants, and trees. Inside the campus, there was the beautiful construction of a number of astronomical instruments. But all the instruments were not in good condition. There was lack of maintenance of these instruments. The Jantar Mantar is situated at the good location and in the centre of the Delhi. Here I knew the importance of these astronomical instruments. It was a plasure to visit here.

Name: Rasheedur Rahman Shihab
Title: Tourist Attraction
Review: The place has a large tourist attraction in Delhi. A must visit place for all the tourists if you are in Delhi.

Name: gargichat
Title: Poor maintenance
Review: This is a huge open air astronomical observatory. Was sad to see that this 250 odd years old structure, with many instruments, in the heart of the capital city, is suffering from poor maintenance. Some pieces are broken, others need paint. Slightly dismal overall. While the sign boards are adequate, there is a paucity of trained guides.The grounds are reasonably maintained, where people seemed to be having picnics on a Saturday afternoon. Rs.15 per head ticket might be a deterrent for hordes of people to don't in for the picnic as there was in places like India Gate.Just wish more care was expended for better preservation. And efforts given to create an attractive destination by the authorities, like live demonstration, maybe at a high cost. It could be an interesting place with these improvements.

Name: John_Bristol_England
Title: Stunning architecture / instrumentation
Review: This park comprises a large number of astronomical instruments.  Sounds boring, but these are huge and could at first glance be taken for gigantic early 20th century artworks.In fact they are hundreds of years old, and still deliver good readings of time, date, and much more.There are signs in English explaining how they work, but I believe you would get more from these with a qualified guide.A great way to spend a quiet hour or two away from the noise that is Delhi.

Name: Peter S
Title: Interesting Visit
Review: We came here to learn something about how and why astronomy was important in the past. Unfortunately we got picked up by a "Guide" inside the observatory, just after the entry kiosk, who just wouldn't go away and who was difficult to understand. He had a Tourist-India government pass and just kept talking at us in difficult to understand English and wouldn't go away. We let him do his thing, then went round again at our own pace with time to read the descriptions, which thankfully had English translations.All the descriptions were comprehensive and clear about "what" observations were made and with which instruments. However, there was no information on "how" the instruments were used i.e. how the structures were used in detail, what precision was achieved, what instruments were placed on the structures, how were results recorded etc.We enjoyed our visit overall and my point above is not likely to be an issue for most people but, as an amateur astronomer, I had hoped for more detail to compare with how I go about my observations.

Name: UtkarshMaheshwari
Title: The ancient Science Museum
Review: This is a place not less then an Ancient Science Museum. You will love to see the clock which is designed on the basis of the sun movements. Similarly all the structures are designed so scientifically that one must go and feel proud of our ancestors.

Name: Medagam Praveen
Title: An approach To Astronomical Tables
Review: Served as an observatory in past days,Now it's ruining due to weathering,Mishra Yantra stand main attraction to all of Jantar Mantar place.its An approach To Astronomical Tables in the past

Name: Shounak Patwardhan
Title: Inspiring Ancient Astronomy Instruments
Review: It is quite amazing to understand how interested Maharaja Jai Singh II must have been in Astronomy to build all the instruments in Jantar Mantar. The explanations provided about the instruments are complicated but you can make sense if you read them properly. That being said, it would help a lot more to read about the instruments online in advance. The structures are huge and if you're visiting them on a sunny day, you'll see that they still work perfectly. The area is well maintained, clean and the garden surrounding it is pretty neat. Calm and peaceful surroundings. The place isn't too crowded but if you want even lesser people, visit it in early mornings.

Name: BHUPENDRA s
Title: jantar mantar
Review: gadzet place here you can enjoy with friends and capture good images it has old instruments which u will amaze to see

Name: Ema Datshi
Title: The crazy red skateboard park
Review: I've been to the Jantar Mantars in both Delhi and Jaipur and I like the Delhi one the best. I think it's the deep red colour of the buildings that appeals, plus the general crazy 'feel' of the place.My husband always says this looks like a giant skateboard park. I don't think it matters whether you understand what's there or what it's supposed to do, it's just fun to wander around and soak up the atmosphere.
